comments.text:
It is really sad to realize how deeply rooted racism is in America. And how 
we forget our own history. If we look back to the beginning, we see that 
the real division within the American Colonies wasn't black and white, but 
rich and poor. And it's no different today. But, I guess it's just human 
nature to find somebody to look down on, when you're getting shit on. The 
fact is, that while blacks were being imported as slaves, whites were 
coming to the colonies as indentured servants. Probably 75% of whites who 
arrived, came as indentured servants. And, as bad as the black slaves lives 
were which was really shitty and made worse by the knowledge they had no 
way out, the white indentured servants were often treated worse. The 
majority didn't survive to claim their freedom. Why? Because, they were 
cheap compared to the black slave, who was an asset to be preserved. Also, 
they cost the master money for the payments required at the end of service. 
So, if they didn't survive, well, there was always more where they came 
from.  Logic might suggest that those at the bottom of the food chain would 
find common cause. Unfortunately, those same indentured servants forgot 
their mistreatment at the hands of the wealthy and their common cause with 
blacks,and in the South chose to fight for states rights during the Civil 
War, even though they rarely owned slaves themselves. Their descendents 
were the victims of labor violence in Ford Motor Company, Carnegie Steel, 
and Peabody Coal, just to mention a few. But I guess when the ruling elites 
consider you disposable fodder for their money mills, and you become hill 
billies, red necks, poor white trash, shanty Irish, and any other 
derogatory term they chose to use, then finding some other group even lower 
down the totem pole makes your own situation a bit more bearable. So, now 
we have the ruling elites on top, and the rest of us disenfranchised 
whites, blacks, browns and yellows expending all our energies against each 
other while the rich and powerful continue to look down their noses at us 
and laugh all the way to the bank..﻿
